definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Of good conduct is the Order of the disciples of the Exalted One;
sentences.chinese: 良好行爲是對師尊弟子的誡命。

sentences.english: But they, our forefathers, became arrogant and stiff-necked, and did not obey your commands.
sentences.chinese: 但我們的列祖行事狂傲，硬着頸項不聽從你的誡命。

sentences.english: What is required in the first commandment?
sentences.chinese: 第一誡命吩咐我們作什麼？

sentences.english: These four commandments concern one's relationship with God and worship of God.
sentences.chinese: 這四條誡命是與敬拜上帝與上帝建立關係有關連的。

sentences.english: Commands of God that apply to all people of all times and places.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的誡命適合於所有時代的所有人們。

sentences.english: Keep my commands and follow them.
sentences.chinese: 你們要謹守遵行我的誡命。

sentences.english: All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments .
sentences.chinese: 這兩條誡命，是律法和先知一切道里的總綱。

sentences.english: Yes, I have already cursed them, because you have not set your heart to honor me.
sentences.chinese: 因你們不把誡命放在心上，我已經咒詛你們了。

sentences.english: This is the first and great commandment.
sentences.chinese: 這是誡命中的第一，且是最大的。

sentences.english: The more you live these commandments, the more His spirit can rest with you.
sentences.chinese: 愈是能夠踐行這“兩大誡命”，聖靈愈是與你同在。

sentences.english: You have abandoned the Lord 's commands and have followed the Baals.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你們離棄耶和華的誡命，去隨從巴力。

sentences.english: 40the Prophets hang on these two commandments.
sentences.chinese: 這兩條誡命，是律法和先知一切道里的總綱。

sentences.english: But be continually with a holy man, whomsoever thou shalt know to observe the fear of God.
sentences.chinese: 只該同虔敬的人，常有來往，你知道他是遵守誡命的。

sentences.english: What is forbidden in the second commandment?
sentences.chinese: 第二誡命禁止我們作什麼？

sentences.english: While leaving the commandment of God, you hold the tradition of men.
sentences.chinese: 你們是離棄神的誡命，拘守人的傳統。

sentences.english: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.
sentences.chinese: 我們若遵守他的誡命，就曉得是認識他。

trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
